sources.description:
Kept Husbands (1931) is an American pre-Code drama directed by Lloyd Bacon and distributed by RKO Radio Pictures. This restored and colorized edition breathes new life into a fascinating early talkie that deals with class conflict, gender roles, and marital power struggles during the Great Depression. With Dorothy Mackaill and Joel McCrea leading the cast, the film captures both the glamour and anxieties of its era, showcasing a provocative storyline that reflected the shifting social norms of the early 1930s.

Plot Summary:
Ruth Chatterton (Dorothy Mackaill) is the privileged daughter of steel magnate Arthur Parker. Used to getting what she wants, she becomes infatuated with Dick Brunton (Joel McCrea), a hardworking and honorable steelworker. After Dick performs a heroic act during a factory accident, Ruth insists on pursuing him, despite their vast differences in wealth and background.

Dick is swept into her world of luxury, but the marriage is anything but simple. Ruth expects Dick to adapt to her elite lifestyle, while Dick struggles with the feeling that he is being treated less as a husband and more as a possession. The title reflects the film‚Äôs central tension ‚Äî is Dick truly a partner in marriage, or is he merely a ‚Äúkept husband‚Äù supported and controlled by his wife‚Äôs fortune? As tensions escalate, the story confronts issues of pride, love, social class, and the definition of masculinity during a time when traditional roles were already under strain.

Kept Husbands is a classic example of pre-Code Hollywood ‚Äî a period when studios produced bold, socially provocative films before the enforcement of the Hays Code in 1934. The movie touches on themes of gender politics, financial independence, and the social discomfort surrounding women in positions of power. Dorothy Mackaill delivers a strong performance as a wealthy woman unafraid to break conventions, while Joel McCrea, still in the early stages of his career, brings charm and grit to the role of an honest man trapped between love and pride.

sources.description:
Stars: Clara Kimball Young, Joel McCrea, Dorothy Mackaill
 Director: Lloyd Bacon

 A steelworker Richard saves two of fellow workers after a factory accident. In gratitude, his millionaire boss invites him for dinner, where his daughter is instantly infatuated and vows to marry him.Unfortunately, he finds her appetite for extravagances begins to wear him down, financially and emotionally until he becomes a 'kept husband.'

metadata.Plot: Blue collar steelworker Richard Brunton (McCrea) saves two of his fellow workers after an accident at a factory. In gratitude, his boss, millionaire Arthur Parker invites Richard for dinner with his family. Arthur's daughter Dot (Mackaill) is instantly impressed and infatuated with Richard She vows to marry him within a month.She does but Richard's seeming good luck is short-lived when he discovers how spoiled and selfish Dot really is, draining his finances dry in her greed, and he becomes Dot's "kept husband." Richard eventually convinces her to settle down and be happy on his humble salary.
